info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 22 at 5:21PM EDT until August 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Madison County in northwestern Virginia... Northeastern Orange County in central Virginia... Southern Fauquier County in northern Virginia... Southern Culpeper County in northern Virginia... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 521 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Culpeper, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Culpeper, Madison, Brightwood, Raccoon Ford, Catalpa, Stevensburg, Rhoadesville, Rapidan, Oakpark, Everona, Verdiersville, Burr Hill, Pratts, Winston, Lignum, Mitchells, Reva, Fordsville, Twymans Mill and Leon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
